intro: Hybanthus thesiifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hybanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white in color. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
